results.name: Off The Kerb Motorcycle Training
results.rideto_opinion: Off The Kerb Motorcycle Training are a central London school conveniently located in Shepherds Bush. They have a spacious off road training area and the local roads have a lot to offer for the on road element. The instructors are very friendly and knowledgable.

ratings.author: Bridget Christie
ratings.review: I passed my unrestricted Mod 1 & 2 test with Off the Kerb over the past few weeks and have to thank the team, especially John who was my instructor throughout, for their positive advice, expertise and support. A faultless and fun crew!

ratings.author: James Bannister
ratings.review: Completed Mod 1 and Mod 2 tests with these guys and couldn’t fault the training or experience.  I was trained by Steve, Dom and John who understood where my riding was at very quickly and worked with me directly to refine my approach to the road and the examinations.  Their experience was evident and I couldn’t have felt more prepared before each module.  Thanks chaps, felt great binning the L plates.  James

ratings.author: John Fairservice
ratings.review: Steve at ‘Off The Kerb Motorcycle Training’, kept me relaxed me with his calm manner and good humour. I was really worried about learning on a manual for the first time, but all their stage-by-stage steps helped me gain confidence by the afternoon. Got my certificate with their support. 5 out of 5 for great service, patience and professionalism!

ratings.author: Andrew Reyes
ratings.review:
I have just passed my A2 Motorbike test today and I would highly recommend everyone to book with this training centre as they have provided me with excellent support and training. 
Instructors were really informative and gave me honest feedback whilst on and off road. Can't thank them enough!

ratings.author: Lam Yeung
ratings.review: The site is safe and sufficient for CBT and part of the Mod-1 training. Instructors are experienced, excellent and helpful. You will feel confident to ride out with them, even at 70mph on A40. Supporting staff are also good too and can quickly rearrange your next test if you failed. Practical and no nonsense school, highly recommended.

ratings.author: Joe McCrudden
ratings.review: Did my CBT and my unrestricted Mod 1 and Mod 2 (twice!) tests with these guys. They are friendly, supportive, down to earth and all round great teachers. They teach you to ride and not just pass the test. Particular thanks to Dom for helping me through passing all of the stages! I’d strongly recommend Off the Kerb to anyone!

ratings.author: Joe
ratings.review: I've done my CBT, mod 1 & 2 for a A2 license and mod 1 & 2 for my A licence. I've dealt with all the instructors and they are the nicest bunch of bikers you will ever meet. It went from learning, to a nice day riding! would recommend Off The Kerb to everyone!

ratings.author: Quentin Coutellier
ratings.review: I had an absolute blast in this school, the team is very supportive and the instructors great. If you're about to take your licence, then look no further and go off the kerb !!

ratings.author: Richard Salmon
ratings.review: I really wouldn't recommend Off The Kerb to do your CBT training course. I was a first time rider and I found the instructor to lack empathy and unable (or unwilling) to effectively support me in learning how to ride a motorcycle. Since my awful experience here I have successfully completed my CBT elsewhere and had the pleasure of being instructed by thoughtful and effective trainers. If you'd like to learn how to ride a motorcycle do it somewhere else and definitely avoid this place!

ratings.author: Rory Curnock Cook
ratings.review: Just passed my mod 2 test! Have had a fantastic experience with the off the kerb team. Big thank you to Dom for taking me from new rider to license holder

results.name: IPass CBT London
results.rideto_opinion: Ipass are a friendly school located just 2 minutes walk from Richmond station. They have great facilities including cafe, changing rooms and class rooms. The local Richmond roads are a joy to ride on and the training ground is nicely sheltered.

ratings.author: Kimberley Hodge
ratings.review: Took my CBT here on Saturday with Charles. I’m a complete newbie to riding on a scooter - but he was patient, calm, and gave me the extra time and support that I needed to gain enough confidence to go out on the road. I loved it so much I purchased my first scooter that evening. I would highly recommend iPass from an instruction point of view - Charles was great. Only downside for me were the facilities - I was a little surprised on my arrival at the centre that it was based in a car park and so access to toilets/changing areas depended on the building next door being open - which is fine if you don’t run overtime like I did!

ratings.author: Bogdan
ratings.review:
A friend and I had our CBT today with IPASS and it was a definite 5 out of 5 stars experience. We were the 11 am group and Jules arrived on his gorgeous GS1250 at a sharp time. His knowledge, experience, patience, way of explaining, demonstrating and sense of humour were spot on. 

From never ridden a scooter before - to full control of a manual 125cc in few hours time.

Worth mentioning that when mistakes were made (as normal), not only that he had a brilliant way in explaining and demonstrating how to execute the maneuver correctly, but also a fantastic way to relax the riders.

Shame he does not give lessons for DAS yet; but I'll certainly call back in few months - a year time to check-in. 

Thanks Jules! It's been a pleasure.

ratings.author: Mehdi Mfi
ratings.review: Great school, I would recommend. James was our instructor and was very efficient and constructive in his training. He was also very receptive of feedbacks. I had emailed the school the day before and had received prompt response within the hour. If you are thinking to take your CBT this is the place.

ratings.author: Sam Probert
ratings.review: Big thanks to Nick and James for their thorough teaching and patience whilst doing my CBT today. Friendly, professional guys who helped kick-start my venture on two wheels. Highly recommended and look forward to completing the rest of my licence!

ratings.author: Carl Mason
ratings.review: Had an amazing day out completing my CBT with Peter. He was very patient and a great laugh. Will recommend my friends to complete there CBT with these guys. Have also just completed my Gear conversion course with Charles and have to say I was a little nervous but he was straight to the point and patient with myself. Within no time I was driving a geared bike with confidence. I would also like to add the the prices are extremely good and are worth every penny.  Will be back Asap to complete my DAS.

ratings.author: Ashi Werjuka
ratings.review:
"Patience is a virtue", is simply explained, not as the ability to wait, but rather how you behave whilst waiting. Well thanks to Nick and his incredible ability to keep smiling no matter what.

Incredible staff at ipass; capable, efficient and friendly. They waited for those stuck in traffic and explained to those who just could not understand, thus enabling them to pass everyone in the group. 

A day which could have been stressfull and boring, became a lot of fun.

Thanks!!!! Highly recommended!!!!

A+++++++

ratings.author: nyan nyan
ratings.review: Just spent a very nice day doing my CBT with them. I came as a complete newbie and with my expected worries ; ended up happy and confident. Very relaxed yet professional team, I highly recommend them and thank them for the patience and kindness. If they can go the extra mile for you, they will.

ratings.author: Edward Comyn
ratings.review: IpassCBT were highly  professional throughout my training. They were flexible to my booking requirements/timings and were extremely polite. I would definitely recommend them to anyone seeking motorcycle instruction.

ratings.author: A Google User
ratings.review: I had a super day today completing my CBT. Nick was a great teacher and kept me very calm with my first trip out on the road. Would highly recommend.

ratings.author: Gábor Reményi
ratings.review:
I had a fantastic experience with these guys, Nathan in particular as he was my instructor throughout my DAS training. After a short assessment ride on a 125cc I did two days on a Honda CB650F where we practiced for MOD1 and MOD2. Next day I passed my MOD1 test with flying colours, that’s again thanks to Nathan as he made us practice the exercises on a somewhat smaller scale, so on the actual test everything felt spacious. (You’ll appreciate this when you have to do the slalom, U turn or swerve.) I only passed my MOD2 test for the second try, but to be fair failing it for the first time was all on me. (Little tip, don’t cut in front of a lorry on your test haha)
I would say don’t be discouraged by some of the bad reviews here, that’s usually from people who can’t even pass their CBT and/or are a danger to themselves and other road users.

results.name: Alpha Motorcycle Training
results.rideto_opinion: Alpha Motorcycle Training are a long established school in the north west of London. An easy walk from North Wembley tube stop, they are well connected with central London. The team are friendly and professional.

ratings.author: Joshua Bovell
ratings.review:
Passed with Alpha Motorcycle..
Full licence 

I am really impressed with there service when I rang them up to do my full unrestricted licence and discussed  my situation with work they managed to work with me and squeeze me in with good dates completed CBT, Mod1 and Mod2 within a Month.

CBT was carried out by instructor Jason .. 10/10 great Lad nice to speak to and very understanding 

MOD1/MOD2  Was carried out by Martin - Very good Instructor will push you until your perfect 

Overall the company is definitely one of the best good bikes/location/equipment

ratings.author: Nick James
ratings.review:
Tl;dr: book them now, they're excellent.

I had the pleasure to do my Module 1 and Module 2 training with these gents, passing both first time. Martin, Ian, Ewan and Jason all trained me at various times. They are all highly experienced riders who know their bikes, riding and racing like no other school I've been to.

I thoroughly enjoyed my time here and would reccomend anyone and everyone to give them a call. Their calm, comedic and expert instruction is well worth your time and money. They talk you through the gear, bikes, shops and everything else to make you feel safe, knowledgeable well inducted into the biking world. Can't fault them.

Graham, the owner, is also incredibly accommodating.

10/10, would buy them all a pint if I ever have the pleasure of running into them again.

Nick
Maths Teacher, London.

ratings.author: Emma Still
ratings.review:
Des is a great instructor.  Made me feel very calm and relaxed and put me at ease and helped me pass. So altogether amazing instructor.  
A big thank you Des
 Mark bowmen

ratings.author: darrenin Jesus
ratings.review: I have just done my cbt with Des here.  I will say I'm am very happy with everything. He is a great guy and will help you in any area you need to pass.   Thank you Des and God bless

ratings.author: Seb Vivas
ratings.review: I did and passed my CBT recently on Wednesday and I have to say I had a very great time, met very supportive people, especially Des who was my instructor he is an awesome guy. He was always very helpful and down to earth on my performance, learning and more importantly on my safety and awareness on the road. If you want somewhere to learn and become a motorcyclist successfully then this place is for you. Thank you very much Alpha Motorcycle and special thanks to Des 👍.

ratings.author: Raghu Rao
ratings.review:
Best guys at this place. Des was my instructor for the CBT and what a star he is. Even though I have been riding a geared motorbike for more than 14 years now, he made sure that all the processes/rules are followed and he gave the right tips every time. He was simply great to talk to as well...Inspiring, motivational for some weak riders on the day.
I am definitely going back to them for getting a full license. Jason [another great guy] on big bikes explained the process very nicely. I hope he is my instructor for the big bikes as well.
Totally recommend this place due to the passionate people out there. You will leave the place happy. trust me!

ratings.author: Alice DD
ratings.review:
The training here is class, I definitely recommend it! 
The CBT course was extremely thorough and accommodating for all levels and abilities. With their training we progressed quickly, confidently and it was really fun. Without a doubt I will come back here to do a full licence course. Thanks Jason for your invaluable instruction. Top.

ratings.author: Rohail Khan
ratings.review: Completed a DAS for an A2 restricted license with Alpha MCT. The staff here are very helpful and friendly, in particular Martin and Graham, who have both got top banter. Martin, my instructor, was a great guy, strict during riding but a fantastic instructor who took time to explain faults, giving advice for improvement as opposed to engaging in simple fault picking. He's also good at calming the pre-test nerves. Thank you Alpha MCT!

ratings.author: Yusuf Al-Noor Hashim
ratings.review:
I would like to thank Graham and Ian for working with me and getting me through my module 1 and module 2 tests. 

I passed both tests first time making 1 minor mistake in my module 1 test and 2 minor faults in my module 2 test making it 3 minor faults altogether. 

Ian was my instructor whilst I was there and is an absolute genius at his job and will get anyone with a bit of common sense through any of the tests first time around. He's extremely passionate about bikes and about what he does for a living. I fully enjoyed every lesson with Ian and always learnt something new about bikes and about the skills required to pass the tests and to keep myself safe whilst riding. Ian is a very patient instructor and very easy to get on with. Thank you Ian for making me into a real biker!! hahaha

I would also like to thank Graham once again for having the little talk with me before I set off for my module 2 test. The conversation we had really did help calm my nerves a little and put me into the correct frame of mind to pass my test.

Finally I would just like to recommend to anyone wishing to get on 2 wheels to not think about it for too long like I did and just give Alpha motorcycle training a call immediately. Alpha motorcycle training is the greatest school within the Wembley and surrounding areas and I guarantee you wont find anyone better or cheaper. 3 minor faults altogether is a great result and I couldn't have gotten through these tests without the help from Alpha motorcycle training.

Once again thank you to everyone at Alpha motorcycle training and I will see you guys again soon.

ratings.author: Daniel Bediako
ratings.review: I left my CBT feeling really sure I can be safe on the road. I would definitely recommend to both new drivers and experienced. Des was especially amazing and very patient with questions. Great experience.

results.name: Heathrow Motorcycle Training
results.place: Feltham & Hanworth Airparks Leisure, Hanworth, London
results.rideto_opinion: Heathrow Motorcycle Training have a spacious training ground in the heart of west London. Perfect for first time CBT training, the team are highly experienced as serving or ex police officers, very friendly and patient. The road ride covers a variety of quiet roads and different motorcycle riding scenarios.

ratings.author: Joshua Linz
ratings.review: I went from never riding a bike on UK roads to a full licence via direct access (in the space of 6 weeks) with this great team. Passed everything first time - even when I didn't have to confidence in myself I was constantly reassured and given clear, honest instruction. They are always professional and organised. I'd recommend to anyone who wants to learn to ride a bike of any shape or size. I couldn't be happier that I chose this company.

ratings.author: Andy Murphy
ratings.review: Great team that get great results. Mark and Graham work hard to make sure that riders are properly prepared, even those of us that are a little less confident than others.

ratings.author: Kiran Dhoot
ratings.review:
During my Cbt to A2 journey I met most members of the HMT team. They are a fantastic set of instructors with a lot of patience and helped me get a license with only 6 hours of instruction which was top notch in quality. Very friendly and will be coming back for advanced training later on down the line.
Cheers guys !

ratings.author: ceilidh baxter
ratings.review: Did my CBT today with these guys and so glad I did . They was very professional and great instructors. Reading previous reviews I could see they had a great reputation . The course was very thorough and never at any point did I feel that we wasn’t getting anything but the highest quality of training. I was feeling quite anxious at first but I was made to feel at ease and never rushed . When it came to on road training again very professional and thorough.

ratings.author: Joe Welland
ratings.review: Passed my cbt on 09/06/18 and passed my mod 2 with a short course today 27/06/18. Having never used a bike on the road i am chuffed. absolutley enjoyed my time learning with HMT, such a fun and active learning process that really helps you as an individual  feel more confident on a bike. Booking was easy and all dates and times being emailed over all you so cant go wrong.   Highly recomended. Thank you to all at HMT who helped me pass today.

ratings.author: Rob Lewis
ratings.review: Passed my A licence with HMT and what can I say! Brilliant instructors, excellent training, well maintained bikes. A credit to their profession. I highly recommend taking training with with HMT.

ratings.author: Alan W
ratings.review: Done my cbt with these guys 1st time, renewed it after 2 years here again. Would recommend.

ratings.author: MANG IZM
ratings.review: Very pleased with booking my cbt here as I had read previous reviews and was eager to get trained from the best. Luckily I was the only person booked for the day so I had thorough training. If you are looking to do your cbt anywhere I would recommend this place for sure. Very friendly people.

ratings.author: marcos Almeida Caetano
ratings.review: Amazing friendly team, the instructors are nice mood ones , highly recommended. ...tks follows. ..

ratings.author: jose rosa
ratings.review:
José Sousa 

 I recommend Heathrow Motorcycle Training  highly enough. The experience of gaining my motorbike licence with them was absolutely fantastic. 
Graham and Mark are very friendly and professionals. 
 The instructors were all extremely professional with lots of experience allways  polite and helpful,  and the equipment was very good in all espects. 
Thanks guys 
Joe

results.name: Universal Motorcycle Training
results.rideto_opinion: Universal are a professional set up in north London. They have fantastic facilities being based at The Hive stadium. Including a cafe, parking, classrooms, and large off road training area. Local roads are quiet making the road riding element suitable for novices.

ratings.author: Mathew Joseph
ratings.review: Did my CBT training here. Highly professional and well experienced staff.

ratings.author: Bassam M
ratings.review: Dodgy people Cancellation does not get you a refund or you cant rebook for anyother date in the same fee, beaware of them. Dont pay in advance !!!

ratings.author: Belcea Ionut
ratings.review:
2nd time here ! i had to renew my cbt and what can i say is that...this guys are the best.
i would like to thank to jorge (instructor) for all his traning , great guy , big hearth

ratings.author: L2TheDN
ratings.review: 5 Stars, highly recommended. First time ever on a bike. Vicente was very professional and helpful, fantastic instructor, very detailed and made me feel at ease. Would be sure to return to receive some more training!

ratings.author: Deepu James
ratings.review: I had my CBT from here, I got a good instructor, great service and value for money for the motor cycle lessons

ratings.author: Ahmed Mansoor
ratings.review:
I renewed my CBT on Saturday. I brought along my friend, who successfully passed his CBT first time round. I recommened universal motorcycle trtraining to him. The insrtuctor on the day was Vicente, he was very enthusiastic, supportive and paid a lot of attention to detail when explaining. He also tried his best to calm down new riders nerves.

I have already recommeded two other friends last year and continue to do so, I always feel comfortable and confident with the universal team!

I was bit disappointed that no discount is given for riders who have come back to universal for renewal. I think the fee should be discounted. 

Thanks!

Monsur Cbt@Edgware

ratings.author: Diana Battaglio
ratings.review: I'm super happy to leave a five start review to Universal Motorcycle Training! I came to this training centre after a bad experience doing a CBT course at aanother training centre in East Ham. At Universal I've found the most professional and prepared instructors I could have asked for. I initially did a private two-hours lesson with Rashid, such a patient and encouraging instructor that helped me grow my confidence. Lovely Vicky booked me in for my CBT two weeks after. I did the training with Mario, which proved to be the most motivating and prepared instructor ever! The training went really well. The theory part was detailed and well presented on a huge screen, the practical training never felt rushed and every exercise was explained thoroughly, and the road part felt very safe and controlled despite the rain. I'm happy I did my CBT at Universal and I'm planning to continue my training with them as soon as I'll feel ready. A big THANK YOU!

ratings.author: Umar Malik
ratings.review:
A instructor named mario supported me through the course and helped me to reach my full potentil. He is very very funny, professional  and has good customer service. 100% recommended. The bikes fairly descently new. I believe that mario is very supportive. This cbt is linked to tfl. Whatever question I asked I was explained in a apprioate way that I could understand other than that the other instructors were polite and very funny and most importantly professional 

From Umar 😂😂

ratings.author: faroq afg
ratings.review:
Vincent and mark really professional and polite 
Justin no good .

ratings.author: Abdigani Muhummed
ratings.review: I would recommend them to anyone as they actually teach everyone properly about the rules to the road and how to ride safely.

results.name: Phoenix Motorcycle Training Crystal Palace
results.place: Crystal Palace National Sports Centre, London
results.rideto_opinion: Phoenix Motorcycle Training in Crystal Palace is a long established motorcycle CBT school in South London. They offer a large choice of bikes to train on, as well as providing jackets, boots, helmets and gloves as standard. There's an indoor class room for breaks and are just a 2 minute walk from the train station. The local roads are quiet and provide a variety of scenarios for learner riders. Phoenix are the UK's 1st MCIAC Gold Standard School providing the highest standard of motorcycle training.

ratings.author: Joseph Sunderraj
ratings.review: Affordable. Friendly staff. Adequate space for training. Close to train station or bus stop. Car park available

ratings.author: Kirk Alexander
ratings.review:
Highly recommended!!! 

I did my CBT test at the Crystal Palace centre yesterday and couldn't be happier with the whole experience. The instructors on the day Sam and Dan were great! Really friendly, patient and professional. Its been 17 years since ive been on a bike so was a little nervous to start but they both made me feel comfortable and relaxed the whole time and I passed with ease! Thanks again guys!

Kirk

ratings.author: Svea Williams
ratings.review:
The most patient instructors in the world. 
Very informative and thorough. I felt confident that I learnt what I needed to.

ratings.author: Lee Cooper
ratings.review: They are a great school. Knowledgeable, experienced, patient, reasonably priced. Highly recommended.

ratings.author: James Wray
ratings.review:
After being in contact with a very helpful lady called Helen, I Visited Phoenix Motorcycle Training Centre this morning at 8:00 am sharp to carry out my full license motorcycle assessment with a gentleman called Steve. 
Well what can I say? Rode a well kept CB650F in a controlled area, Steve was brilliant! very calm, polite and informative. I was so chuffed after my assessment. I cannot wait to book my DAS with the guys.

the FREE full motorcycle assessment is a brilliant idea and give you an insight/taste into riding a bigger which leaves you wanting more! Highly recommended motorcycle training centre for all types of licenses from CBT to DAS. 

Happy riding! :).

ratings.author: Samuel Currie-Smith
ratings.review: I did my CBT through Phoenix and found them to be excellent. Very friendly guys, good equipment and great instructors. Would recommend  to anyone and everyone. There was no rushing around and I always felt calm and in control. I would challenge anyone who gives Phoenix a bad review as everyone I met were all genuinely lovely and great teachers. Thank you Phoenix.

ratings.author: Mack Galus
ratings.review: First go and both module 1 and 2 passed today. Thanks to Phoenix I learned how to drive motorbike safely even in a difficult weather condition and I get prepared in professional manner to my test. Been trough the coldness (2C’), tiredness and waking up at 5am, but thesame time I have been through the one of the best 3 days of my life! I meet great people, learned a lot, and passed my practical test in first go! You can’t ask for more on this one! Thank you all for your time and patience! Best wishes! Mack.

ratings.author: TK Ryder
ratings.review: Just completed my progression from an A2 licence to the full category A unrestricted, offered me a nice 2 day package, first day including a brush up training for both mod 1 and 2 and the second morning having both the test back to back, only training who was able to give me these dates in a week and a half in advance. Training was good and informative, straight to the point and no wasting time, instructors are friendly and very helpful, a nice space to practice a mod1 mock test and also good knowledge regarding test routes for the mod2 which I was able to ride through before hand, all in all definitely recommend to anyone, added bonus it was also one of the cheaper quotes than I was offered from other schools

ratings.author: andrew truzzi
ratings.review:
I have done my CBT, Module 1 and just completed my Module 2 today all done with Phoenix. 
These guys are by far the best out there nothing is to much trouble, great coaching from start to finish from Nick with my Mod 1 and Mark with mod 2 I've gone from complete novice to a confident safe rider in no time 
with their help 

All the best guys

ratings.author: Rafe Clutton
ratings.review: Great service from start to finish from the guys at Crystal Palace & New Addington. Took me from never having ridden to full licence and I felt totally comfortable all the way through. They build your confidence and make sure you aren't rushed if there's something you're struggling with. Can highly recommend all of the instructors.

results.name: North London Motorcycle Training
results.rideto_opinion: North London Motorcycle Training in Edgware is a long established CBT test and motorcycle training school. With purposed built facilities and a motorcycle shop on site, the team are well equipped to help new riders through their first steps. The local roads quickly roll out into the countryside, providing a enjoyable roads to learn to ride on. The instructors are friendly with free tea and coffee provided on site.

ratings.author: DiL S
ratings.review: Done the 2 Day DAS course. I was very nervous about failing but the training was absolutely amazing. Easy to talk to, nice as hell and can't point even a single issue to improve. Anyone i know needs their license you better believe i'm sending them here.

ratings.author: Thang Doan
ratings.review:
Got my motorcycle license after 5 days of training here. The teachers are friendly, helpful and patient.0

The bikes are all Suzuki for the A license, and mixed brands for CBT. I wouldn't comment about the CBT bikes as they are used everyday by newbies so the quality can't be expected too much. The 600cc bikes are all V twin so lots of torque low end and easy to ride for nervous beginners who wouldn't want to twist the acceleration too much. However, make sure you get one of the newest bikes for your mod 2 test as they are less used, have lighter clutch and have anti-stall function. You're normally assigned one anyway but just make sure to ask.

Classes and exams are usually fully booked during summer months. I had to wait 1 month after passing my mod 1 test to be able to take mod 2. Probably booking them all in advance if you're confident will save some waiting time.

ratings.author: Brian R
ratings.review: Terrific place, great bikes, great instructors, friendly helpful staff.  I went from no experience at all to passing both mod1 and mod2 first time in a week of training.  Christine made the CBT part smooth and easy, and Leo was fantastic for my DAS course, always calm and professional no matter how badly we rode.  I initially thought it was expensive but it's typical for London and given the ~7 hours of 1:2 instruction per day it's actually pretty good value for money.  Even better, they even arranged for me to borrow a 125cc bike for free for a day just to get some more riding experience in which made all the difference.  Totally recommended.

ratings.author: Quincy Jones
ratings.review: I would highly recommend this place, the staff are amazing. I did my das here, and it was a great experience, 1 of the trainers said to me 1 day, that his aim is to teach us to ride safely, and if we pass our test,then that's a bonus. A good moral to have.

ratings.author: Bee Silvia
ratings.review:
I am so glad to say I PASSED DAS!!
Very very pleased with the training school, I booked 3 days training, excellent very helpful and friendly instructors! English is my second language and had some trouble at the beginning but these boys were very understanding and patient! The bikes were 5* too, I can’t imagine doing test on a different one! 
I can only recommend!! 
Thank you so much for Leo, Joe and Ricky!!
Very happy🙌🙌

results.name: A2Z Rider Training
results.place: New River Sports Leisure Centre, London
results.rideto_opinion: A2Z motorcycle training is a family run CBT training centre based in North London. A2Z Rider Training aim is to provide the best quality CBT training whilst ensuring you learn in a safe yet fun environment. With 30 years of CBT training experience, A2Z are comfortable with all levels of riders.

ratings.author: Michelle Naessens
ratings.review: Had a great experience doing my CBT at A2Z Rider Training. I'd never been on a bike before, let alone a geared one. The instructors were incredible. They made me feel at ease and I had an overall fantastic time on the bike. 10/10 would recommend.

ratings.author: Alexis Bianchi
ratings.review:
Couldn’t be happier about my riding experience with A2Z, taking my DAS and passing MOD1/MOD2 first time. From the moment you book your course with Tina over the phone, you know you’ve made the right choice. Tina is considerate and always trying to help, managing course times around your schedule. 
Once you start your course things get even better. I was training with Rob who not only has bucket loads of experience, but is also a great guy to spend time with, making the training days very enjoyable and educational. Rob trains you well above test standards and prepares you for every elements of both tests. In parallel to my training with Rob, I also had the pleasure of spending time with Shane who made sure everyone was having a good time and sharing his own perspective on the test.
All in all, a great team and a fantastic atmosphere. In fact, even in the stress-inducing environment that is the test centre waiting room, you could easily tell Rob and Shane were the two instructors there with the most rapport with their students (by a mile..). 
I passed MOD1/MOD2 first time and on the same day, and would recommend A2Z to anyone interested in taking their test. Thanks team!

ratings.author: sean murray
ratings.review:
The instructors were beyond experienced. Stuart is an ex-examiner, and knows what he's chatting about. Rob was an ex-police motorcycle rider and I think he had more years under his belt than I've been alive!!
I'm pretty sure the school is the only one that allows you to practice on the Mod1 site the Sunday before your test. So you're literally test-ready not suggestively test ready.
Of the 3 others I did my Mod1 with 3 of us got no minors and the other guy got 1.

They prepare you for the Mod2 thoroughly basically testing your testable ability on every road ride and providing truly thorough feedback on your ride.

I can't fault them, they block book so if you pass your mod1, you'll be taking your mod2 the same day 😊

Ultimately I passed, so I have much love for this school!!

ratings.author: Carer Shifts
ratings.review: Ozzie took our small group of 4 riders. Excellent tuition. Felt very thorough but efficient. He adapted his teaching to suit each of our needs. Very pleased I chose A2Z. Thanks

ratings.author: D D
ratings.review:
Great riding school, managed to get me through both Mod1 and Mod2 from the first time. I wasn't great on a bike before the course, so I took the longer version. Tina managed to adjust the schedule to help with work and I started very soon, which fit just right. The plan was to learn a lot and pass the tests before my theory test expired, two days after the Mod1/2 date. Thanks to the great instruction from Shane it all worked out perfectly.
The bikes are quite new and easy to handle. Also, practicing on the exam location helped a lot, both for Mod1 and Mod2. I'd have probably failed on the swerve of Mod1 if I hadn't done it several times before the test. And for Mod2 I was out mostly on roads which we had covered during the training, which helped immensely.
Can't recommend them enough, very patient, level-headed, very good at helping me at build confidence with the bikes and on the road, great instruction.

ratings.author: Neil Gillespie
ratings.review: A2Z are a fantastic training school, brilliant instructors and brilliant bikes! I recently past my Mod 1 and Mod 2 first time thanks to Ossie and Shane’s incredible teaching and instruction. Big thanks to Tina for being super efficient with the administrative side of things as-well. Highly recommend A2Z motorcycle training.

ratings.author: Frank Loots
ratings.review: Outstanding riding school. My instructor, Rob was as much a guardian as a mentor on the road. Detailed, comprehensive and relaxed training and instruction. You could not be more ready for the tests after spending the course time with these instructors. Passed first time out in the most appalling weather conditions. Rob and Shane's attendance with us on test day was confidence inspiring and helped a great deal with the nerves. A school by bikers for bikers. From the excellent and seamless administration by the lovely Tina, supportive assessment of my riding ability by Ozzie to the instruction by Rob, I cannot recommend them more.

ratings.author: ted bennett
ratings.review:
An absolutely brilliant team of people working to make you the best rider on the roads. 

Did my DAS with these guys and it was great. Everybody at A2Z makes you feel comfortable and relaxed. 

I would highly recommend them to anybody thinking about getting their licence. 

The bikes they use are lovely and new.

ratings.author: Jason Whitmore
ratings.review:
Just helped me through my DAS course first time. They have really good bikes and very patient instructors. 

Thanks so much to Rob and Shane for all your advice, you gave me the best platform that you could have on my 5 day intensive course and I'm so glad I was able to convert that into a pass.

ratings.author: Kate Townsend
ratings.review: All the instructors were patient, supportive and knowledgeable. I felt welcome and in good hands as soon as I walked on to the site. Overall it was a really fun day and I feel confident enough (and excited!) to hit the roads solo. Would love to see more women giving it a go!

results.name: London Motorcycle Rider Training
results.rideto_opinion: LMRT are a long established training school in the heart of South London. The local roads are varied and give good exposure for new riders. The team are friendly and very knowledgeable.

ratings.author: Jasper de Windt
ratings.review: I’ve been through 3 different training facilities and 5 different trainers when doing my CBT, Mod 1, Mod 2 (unfortunately failed the first time) and Mod 2 again and finally ended up at LMRT with Nathan. LMRT was by far the best experience I had. Nathan is strict but fair (exactly what I needed) and treats people with respect. He obviously knows his stuff like no other and gives you the confidence you need to get your license. I would recommend this to anyone and everyone! Thanks again for all the help!

ratings.author: Luke Walsh
ratings.review: I've been through the full spectrum with LMRT. Starting with CBTs on a moped, a geared conversion course, geared CBTs right through to DAS. I can honestly say I've enjoyed it all. Nathan was really supportive and informative as a teacher, when I was doing the DAS course and his approach really worked for me. Some comments have said the training area is too small. But when you're doing DAS if you can manage the manoeuvres there, the proper mod1 set up is a really easy. Overall, I would recommend this school for whatever aspect of motorcycling you're looking at.

ratings.author: Mohammad Ahmed
ratings.review: Really nice instructors that are knowledgeable and good teachers. They let me do my cbt on a manual even when I accidentally booked myself for an automatic.

ratings.author: adam pun
ratings.review: Really nice instructors that are knowledgeable and good teachers. They let me do my cbt on a manual even when I accidentally booked myself for an automatic.

ratings.author: yonas mosazghi
ratings.review: i don't recommend anyone to take CBT test at this place. After 40 minutes we all was told our days ends now except 1 guy. Because we dropped their bike and said we broke them. Hell man we paid £20 for them. Instead of going there go search There are many good CBT training in London.

ratings.author: Joanne Croft
ratings.review: I chose this training centre as it was closest to where I live. I paid to do my CBT on a manual bike but when I arrived they suggested I start on a auto. I was clearly very nervous and a complete novice. I felt that they concentrated more an the more able riders. The safety talk was informative. At 11.30 after paying £130 for the whole day. I was then told I wasn't safe enough to go out on the road so I was sent home and told I could go back next week and charge me another £60. If the other instructor was left behind he could of giving me more training onsite. Very disappointed.

ratings.author: Ryan Hooks
ratings.review:
I paid to be trained on a manual bike and they called the day before to insist I trained on an auto, I was not refunded the extra cost for that.

The training was on quite a small area made smaller still by a van unloading chairs into a storage unit during our session. There was no bike specific highway code discussion prior to the ride and considering one of our group was 16 and had never been out on the road I'm surprised nothing happened.

Overall the CBT was successfully completed in about 4 hours, I felt reasonably confident on the scooter. My experience felt a little rushed and gave me the impression that they mainly operated on renewing expired CBTs. No one at this place was rude but there wasn't much enthusiasm.

I went elsewhere to learn to ride and geared bike and do a DAS course. I'm glad I didn't take my DAS with this school.

ratings.author: Nick Shay
ratings.review: Did my CBT here, really friendly staff and had a great time doing the test.

ratings.author: Marta Nowaczyk
ratings.review:
Thanks Nathan!
Very friendly and professional staff.
I recommend it wholeheartedly :)

ratings.author: William Evans
ratings.review:
As usual these guys are great, went in for my refresher CBT. done very quickly, cannot be happier with them enough. hopefully this be my last CBt test and soon ill go for my DAS. 

Happy Days.

W Evans.

results.name: Stadium Rider Training
results.rideto_opinion: Stadium Rider Training in Walthamstow have one of the largest motorcycle CBT training grounds in London. Based in the Ikea carpark there is plenty of room for learning how to ride in a safe environment. The local roads are quiet and varied and there are amenities close by for food and transport. There's an indoor classroom and the staff are knowledgable and friendly.

ratings.author: Ozzy Gull
ratings.review:
Done My A2 to a full license With Chris at stadium riders. I would definetely recommend him as a instructor as I have previously done cbt and tests with other places . He is full of banter and makes you feel at home and you will definatly pick up very important tips and knowledge From him! 

Nice choice of bikes that are very well maintained and safe and a very nice ground to practice on . 
Ticks all the boxes you will need for preparing for tests 🙂

ratings.author: abdul kahar
ratings.review: chris is a excellent instructor I did my cbt there he’s observation skill is at a high standard I would recommend this to anyone taking there cbt or full motorbike licence thanks again all the best

ratings.author: david juhos
ratings.review:
A HUGE thank you for Chris! I passed everything 1st time! I can only recommend him!
Chris is a very patient and nice person, I think he is the best to choose. He helped a lot (not only in the license, he can give you really good advices about bikes, maintenance...)
The whole training process was a great fun, I enjoyed every moment.

ratings.author: Mariane To
ratings.review: Chris is the best instructor ever! I can only recommend him!

ratings.author: Aziz Aksozlu
ratings.review:
Past my A2 licence with them, great instructors.
Looking forward to doing my A licence soon.

ratings.author: Marcus Harding
ratings.review: Passed my MOD 2 first time thanks to Chris. Fully enjoyed and learnt a lot. All the best Chris

ratings.author: Sevgi Deveci
ratings.review: Glad to have passed my CBT with Stadium Rider. Chris not only taught me how to ride with confidence but also to believe in myself. Without his knowledge and great sense of humour, I would not have been able to learn to ride - or take my feet off the ground for that matter. If you want to learn to ride and have a laugh, Stadium Rider is the place to be!

ratings.author: Farheen Owasil
ratings.review: These guy are the best and friendliest instructors ever. They are very helpful and I have done all of my tests from CBT to MOD 2 with them and them only. I have also recommended multiple family members and friends some of whom have also gone and passed - and also had nothing but good things to say. LOVE THESE GUYS!

ratings.author: Amir Arshad
ratings.review: My experience with stadium rider has been incredible from the quick and easy response to fantastic training from Mike himself who knows exactly what you need to do and where you need to improve would recommend to any family friends and whoever wants to do any sort of course regarding a motorbike this is the place to go. When I was searching to take on direct access I really couldn't find proper reviews to imagine some sort of insight to what I should expect. My experience started when I was told by a friend of mine about the law changing in January 19th I got scared as it was going to affect me as I am only 22. My mate passed restricted licence first time and recommended me to stadium riders. I spoke to Mike and he was very helpful to what I needed to do and was straight up with what to expect. For the price it was a bargain as everyone else out there was charging 700+ I got it for 580 that includes 3 sessions for training and in between module 1 and 2. Purely because of Mike's teaching skills I also passed first time and now I can't wait to get my first bike:) As for training I was dreading it as I have minimum experience on a bike but Mike's thorough training regimes where extraordinary and the way any student can pick up the skills needed was what every rider who wants to do their test needs. Mike can easily point out what needs to be done and work on weak points for best possible outcome. Advice for any student as long as you take on board what the trainer says and don't show no arrogance 'thinking you know everything you will pass'. Also I was so nervous for module 1 and 2 but Mike's helpful pet talks done the job and he tells you what to expect, also he go through every single obstacle that may pop up in the test.Thanks Mike for a great experience and teachings, appreciate your patience and  skills and can't wait till we go Brighton for fish and chips :)

ratings.author: Imran ul Haque
ratings.review:
Mike is an excellent instructor; he is supportive, patient and flexible. It was only with Mike's excellent support and guidance I passed my module 1 and 2 at first attempt. 

Thank you Mike!

results.name: Get My CBT Walthamstow
results.rideto_opinion: Get My CBT Walthamstow is a long established CBT test course training centre located in Walthamstow North London. Close to public transport and local amenities makes it a convenient location for CBT training in North London. The site provides a choice of automatic or manual motorcycles and all the equipment required for training within a competitive price. The local roads are varied and quiet for new riders learning to ride.

ratings.author: A Google User
ratings.review: Just passed my cbt today and it was a great experience. My instructor Kate was brilliant! Made me feel at ease very quickly and was a very good teacher.Loads of advice which made being a new rider a lot less nerve-wracking! I would recommend them to anyone and I will be doing my full bike licence with them also.

results.name: AVSCO Motorcycle Training
results.place: The Bike Den Watford, 504 Bushey Mill Ln, Watford
results.rideto_opinion: AVSCO Motorcycle Training in Watford is a CBT and full motorcycle licence training centre, recently under new management. Conveniently located near central Watford, North London. CBT training starts at The Bike Den bike shop. The instructors are professional and friendly, providing a great experience for first time riders.

ratings.author: Jack Waldock
ratings.review: (March 2016) My experience with Avsco Bike Courses has confirmed to me that the instructors truly have a passion for motorcycling. They were very enthusiastic when talking about bikes and their years of experience certainly showed when they gave me and each person there helpful tips with the little things some of us struggled with. Really happy with my experience!

results.name: Phoenix Motorcycle Training Croydon
results.rideto_opinion: Phoenix Motorcycle Training in Croydon is a long established motorcycle CBT school in South London. Phoenix are the UK's 1st MCIAC Gold Standard Training School providing the highest standard of motorcycle training. They offer a large choice of bikes to train on for all sizes and abilities as well as providing jackets, boots, helmets and gloves as standard. The site is a 5 minutes’ walk from Croydon Tramlink and a number of buses pass nearby.

ratings.author: Vincent Whiteman
ratings.review: Did my CBT, Mod 1 and Mod 2 training here. Staff were brilliant and the equipment was all well maintained. Would recommend these guys for sure.

ratings.author: Matthew Sandy
ratings.review: This was my first time on any vehicle and found it quite a challenge to say the the least. However the instructors were brilliant. They stuck with me and made sure that I understood what they were teaching. The bikes appeared to be brand new and were a pleasure to ride. I didn’t pass this time (no fault of the instructors) but I will go for the continuation coarse. I could not reccomend Phoenix more and will come back for all my progression courses! A massive thank you to peter and Stuart, you do an amazing job!

ratings.author: Elizabeth Ann
ratings.review: Instructors very friendly! Don't let you give up

ratings.author: TaNaBaN TheHULKpzt
ratings.review:
Excellent training for a CBT Marc and wynn were the 2 Instructors. Treated everyone fairly and respectfully. Both took the time on a cold January morning to make sure all 6 students were catered for effectively.
There was some clear differences in level of student ability but the instructors helped those that needed through. 
1 fault that almost lost a star.... No coffee no milk and no loo roll to help stop my nose running as it was so cold 😂
Will return to complete my full license as soon a possible. Thanks guys

ratings.author: Markus Atlan
ratings.review: Second rate 'instructors', who look down on beginners. Especially if you are non-white. Rude, unhelpful who take pleasure in bullying others when they banked their money. Seen it with my own eyes - Wynne. ''Do as I say or you're out and 'forget about any refunds''. They're blind to the fact that it's the learners who pay their wage not the other way round. Don't waste your money and time with these muppets.

ratings.author: Pedro Henrique Ribeiro
ratings.review: I done my CBT on a very cold December day. I was extremely excited and I was not disappointed.  Trainer was extremely experienced. The bikes were all mostly new. I was recommended to go to different CBT centre but came here purely down to the price and was not disappointed. In a few months I will be looking to do my full Bike licence and I will  100%  consider the phoenix school. I wanted to write a review because its always nice for people who are just looking for as decent place to do their CBT

ratings.author: charlotte lamb
ratings.review: This place was amazing! I was very nervous but the instructor was incredibly friendly and helpful. When I made silly errors I was well advised and reassured. I could not recommend this place more! If I went in to do further tests I would definitely go here!

ratings.author: ilyas kuş
ratings.review: I was very happy with the trainers but l was not happy at all with the management. They don't understand about equal opportunities so they let me down on that l had to go second time and £80 more which was  not supposed to. They need push the service because they weren't very good with me...

ratings.author: Andrew Fanthome
ratings.review: Great instructors, I now feel confident to drive on the road. Thanks.

ratings.author: Keith Galvau
ratings.review:
First class instructors, training, staff, bikes, equipment, facilities and instruction.
Very professional instructors who were very experienced, friendly, passionate, competent, patient and a pleasure to be in their company.
Special thanks to Peter, Steve, Keith, Craig, Dan, Stuart and Ben for all their help, advice and guidance.
Would recommend without reservation.
